newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: GFN says smelter to close for several weeks.
newsitem.headline: GFN says smelter to close for several weeks.

text.p: Gold Fields Namabia said on Thursday that its Tsumeb Corp Ltd unit's lead smelter would close for several weeks due to post-commissioning problems.
Gold Fields Namibia director Clive Wolve-Coote said the Ausmelt lead smelter had already been closed down for a couple of days.
"That plant will be down for several weeks. It has been down for a couple of days already," he said.
Gold Fields Namibia produced 917 tones of lead in the quarter ended March 31.
Earlier parent firm Gold Fields of South Africa Ltd said Tsumeb's tailings plant was recommissioned in February and its performance was improving steadily.
But it added the new lead smelter was experiencing problems and the refactory lining of the roof of the smelter would have to be replaced.
